short_description: medi-aid is a senior care and assisted living facility based in sydney, australia.
long_description: since 1971, medi-aid has provided affordable accommodation for elderly individuals and couples, especially those experiencing financial hardship. as a non-profit organisation, care and compassion is at the heart of all that we do. the advice stuck and throughout 50 years, 1000s of australians have benefitted from enjoying retirement in one of our properties in sydney & on the gold coast. years of service. discover what retirement living looks like when you combine decades of experience with a genuine desire to provide a comfortable and affordable lifestyle. explore the range of medi-aid independent living apartments. medi-aid also own properties from which it obtains rentals which are used to support its benevolent activities in other areas of accommodation. from health and wellness advice to community news and events, we're here to help you live your best life. rediscover your passion in retirement through captivating hobbies. from gardening to writing, photography to dancing, embrace fulfilment and purpose in this vibrant chapter of life.
business_tags: assisted living | independent living | retirement living | retirement villages | affordable housing | independent living apartments | overall wellness | wellness advice | nutrition & diet | health and benefits | art journals | help & tips | financials and reports | intraocular lenses | eye surgeries
generated_description: medi-aid centre foundation, legally known as medi-aid centre foundation limited, founded in 1973 by dr. john f. knight am and his wife noreen v. knight, rn, is a public benevolent institution and registered charity based in sydney, new south wales. the foundation provides affordable housing and care services for elderly individuals, particularly those who are frail, lack family support, and have no additional funds. medi-aid currently cares for approximately 500 people, with 30% contributing to the "resident funding housing scheme." the organization also offers assisted living and independent living options, and it provides cost-effective intraocular lens replacements for elderly australians who cannot afford health benefits. medi-aid's properties, which range from 300 to 400 units, are located in sydney and the gold coast.
